subject: Negotiation
title: The Western Obsession with Contracts
description: A quick, practical guide to The Western Obsession with Contracts.

hook.text: Americans trust a 50-page contract. The Chinese wonder why you need 50 pages if we trust each other.

buildup.text: Western legal systems build trust through detailed written agreements enforced by courts.

discovery.text: In relationship-based cultures, excessive contracts signal distrust â€” the opposite of the intended message.

twist.text: A contract is only as strong as the relationship behind it. Without trust, even perfect contracts fail.

climax.text: The best cross-cultural approach: build the relationship first, then document agreements both sides understand.

punchline.text: A good relationship makes sure you never need the contract.

quiz.question: Why can detailed contracts backfire in relationship-based cultures?
options: They signal distrust rather than professionalism
